assets.description: The core of a cloudstead, CloudOs manages the system, accounts and apps on your cloudstead

hostname.label: Hostname
hostname.info: The name of your cloudstead. For example, if your cloudstead's fully qualified domain name is something.example.com, then the Parent Domain is "example.com" and the Hostname is "something"

parent_domain.label: Parent Domain
parent_domain.info: The parent domain of your cloudstead. For example, if your cloudstead fully qualified domain name is something.example.com, then the Parent Domain is "example.com" and the Hostname is "something"

ssl_cert_name.label: SSL Certificate Name
ssl_cert_name.info: The name of the SSL certificate to install

server_tarball.label: CloudOs Server Bundle
server_tarball.info: URL of the CloudOs server bundle

server_port.label: CloudOs Server Port
server_port.info: CloudOs API will listen on this port (on localhost only)

admin_initial_pass.label: Admin Initial Password
admin_initial_pass.info: This is a hash that is used to validate the correct password during first-time setup

recovery_email.label: Recovery Email
recovery_email.info: This is the email address that receives the first-time setup message when the cloudstead is ready to be unlocked

aws_access_key.label: AWS Access Key
aws_access_key.info: Credentials used to write to S3 for backups and other purposes

aws_secret_key.label: AWS Secret Key
aws_secret_key.info: Credentials used to write to S3 for backups and other purposes

aws_iam_user.label: AWS IAM User
aws_iam_user.info: This IAM user ensures the cloudstead may only read/write to its own private slice of a shared S3 bucket

s3_bucket.label: S3 Bucket Name
s3_bucket.info: Backups and other data will be encrpyted and written to this bucket

appstore.user.label: CloudOs AppStore Identifier
appstore.user.info: This identifies your CloudOs instance with the CloudOs AppStore.

appstore.base_uri.label: CloudOs AppStore Base URL
appstore.base_uri.info: The URL of the CloudOs AppStore API

authy.user.label: Authy API Token
authy.user.info: This is your API key with Authy. You can find it in your Authy control panel.

authy.base_uri.label: Authy URL
authy.base_uri.info: Choose the sandbox server for testing purposes, or the production server if you're ready for prime time.

dns.user.label: DNS User
dns.user.help: If using cloudos-dns (for example in conjunction with djbdns), this is the login to the cloudos-dns API

dns.account.label: Dyn Account
dns.account.info: Name of the Dyn account that this username is a member of
dns.account.help: If using cloudos-dns, this value is ignored

dns.password.label: Dyn Password
dns.password.info: The password for the Dyn username
dns.password.help: If using cloudos-dns, this is the password for the given username

dns.zone.label: Dyn Zone
dns.zone.help: If using cloudos-dns, this value is ignored

dns.base_uri.label: Dyn URL
dns.base_uri.help: If using cloudos-dns, this is the URL of the cloudos-dns API

dns.enabled.label: Enable DNS
dns.enabled.info: If disabled, no changes to DNS will be made
